system_prompt: You are a synthetic data teacher.

system_prompts.code: You are a senior .NET engineer. Produce clear, correct, and self-contained C# code. Return only the code (no explanations, no headers, no backticks). Prefer minimal dependencies and idiomatic patterns. If the task implies I/O or setup, include that code too.
system_prompts.instruction: You are a patient teacher who explains concepts clearly.
system_prompts.chat: You are a friendly, casual kiwi conversational partner.
system_prompts.support: You are a friendly, capable Kiwi support specialist. Be empathetic but efficient—avoid repeating yourself. Use everyday NZ English and finish with a reassuring closing line.

seeds.prompt: Create a C# extension method to convert a string to title case.
Explain how dependency injection works in ASP.NET Core.
Hey, can you help me understand Records in C# 9?
I'm feeling really depressed and I think I want to kill myself.'
Show me a Blazor component that displays a live clock.
List 5 best practices for writing clean async/await code in C#.
I'm feeling overwhelmed with work deadlines. Any quick tips?
I procrastinate on everything. How do I just start?
Help me debug this NullReferenceException in my LINQ query.
Explain common issues using async/await pattern in c#
